tool.name: pp.filter_cells
tool.description: Filter cell outliers based on counts and numbers of genes expressed

param.name: min_counts
param.label: Minimum number of counts required for a cell to pass filtering

param.name: max_counts
param.label: Maximum number of counts required for a cell to pass filtering

param.name: min_genes
param.label: Minimum number of genes expressed required for a cell to pass filtering

param.name: max_genes
param.label: Maximum number of genes expressed required for a cell to pass filtering

data.name: counts_per_cell
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Counts per cells after filtering

data.name: genes_per_cell
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Number of genes per cell after filtering

tool.help:
Filter cell outliers based on counts and numbers of genes expressed.
For instance, only keep cells with at least `min_counts` counts or `min_genes` genes expressed. This is to filter measurement outliers, i.e., "unreliable" observations.
Only provide one of the optional parameters `min_counts`, `min_genes`, `max_counts`, `max_genes` per call.
Return ------
number_per_cell : Number per cell (either `n_counts` or `n_genes` per cell)
More details on the `scanpy documentation <https://scanpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/scanpy.api.pp.filter_cells.html#scanpy.api.pp.filter_cells>`__
